patterns: what is the Eligibility Criteria for Admission to MBA Courses in the college?
responses: Eligibility for MBA :The minimum qualification for admission to first year of the MBA is a pass in undergraduate course (10 + 2 + 3).•70% of the seats are allotted based on the merit in the Integrated Common Entrance Test (ICET) conducted by Govt. of Andhra Pradesh.•30% of the seats are earmarked for Management Quota candidates.

patterns: What is the Eligibility Criteria for Admission to M.Tech Courses in the college?
responses: Eligibility for M.Tech: The minimum qualification for admission into M.Tech is a pass in B.E / B.Tech in concern stream.•70% of the seats are allotted based on GATE score / rank obtained in PGECET for M.Tech Course.•30 % of the seats are earmarked for Management Quota candidates.

patterns: what is the Eligibility Criteria for Admission to B.Tech Courses in the college?
responses: Eligibility for B.Tech : The minimum qualification for admission to first year of the B.Tech course is a pass in the Intermediate (10 + 2) conducted by the board of Intermediate education, Govt. of Andhra Pradesh with Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry as optional subjects.•70 % of the seats are allotted based on the merit in the Engineering, Agriculture and Pharmacy Common Entrance Test (EAPCET) conducted by Govt. of Andhra Pradesh.•30 % of the seats are earmarked for Management Quota candidates.•In addition to the above, Diploma holders are admitted in second year of B.Tech to the extent of 10% of intake based on the merit in the Engineering Common Entrance Test (ECET), under lateral entry scheme conducted by Govt. of Andhra Pradesh.

patterns: What is the  vision and mission of college?
responses: VISION: To be a leading institution of women empowerment producing internationally accepted professionals with psychological strength, emotional balance and ethical values. MISSION: M1:To empower women engineers through innovative teaching-learning practices.•M2:To encourage for higher education and research with well-equipped laboratories. M3:To promote entrepreneurship through creativity and innovation. M4:To promote environmental sustainability and inculcate ethical, emotional and social consciousness.
